derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French tablete, from a diminutive of Latin tabula (see table)

entry.def: A tablet is a small solid round mass of medicine which you swallow.

example.ex: It's time for your tablets, dear...
It is never a good idea to take sleeping tablets regularly.
example.tran: 频繁服用安眠药绝对不是好办法。

entry.def: Clay tablets or stone tablets are the flat pieces of clay or stone which people used to write on before paper was invented.

example.ex: He also studied the ancient stone tablets from around the pyramids.
example.tran: 他还研究了在金字塔周围发现的古代石匾。

means.word_mean: 1. a slab of stone or wood suitable for bearing an inscription
2. a number of sheets of paper fastened together along one edge
3. a small flat compressed cake of some substance;
4. a dose of medicine in the form of a small pellet

Sentence.sentence: He repeatedly took an existing but half-formed idea－the mouse-driven computer, the digital music player, the smartphone, the tablet computer（平板电脑）－and showed the rest of the industry how to do it properly.
Doctors use tablet computers for their work in hospitals

At the recent unveiling of a tablet computer by Jeff Bezos of Amazon, whose company is doing the best job of following Apple's lead in combining hardware, software, content and services in an easy-to-use bundle, there were several attacks at Apple.
